headline: AMD earnings, Netflix-Warner Bros. hearing: What to Watch
summary: Market Domination Overtime Host Josh Lipton previews several of the biggest stories to come tomorrow, Tuesday, February 3, including earnings results from companies like Advanced Micro Devices (AMD), Chipotle Mexican Grill (CMG), Pfizer (PFE), and Merck (MRK), and the Senate hearing on Netflix's (NFLX) proposed bid to acquire Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

Discovery (WBD).

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

headline: Assessing Amgen (AMGN) Valuation After Ending Kyowa Kirin Rocatinlimab Collaboration
summary: Amgen (AMGN) has just walked away from its licensing and collaboration agreement with Kyowa Kirin on rocatinlimab for atopic dermatitis, a portfolio reshuffle that shifts responsibility back to Kyowa Kirin and repositions Amgen’s near term pipeline focus. See our latest analysis for Amgen. Those portfolio moves sit alongside a share price that has climbed to US$344.68, with a 30 day share price return of 5.2% and a 1 year total shareholder return of 23.14%, which suggests that momentum has...

headline: Amgen Lawsuit Over 340B Discounts As Stock Trades Near Valuation Targets
summary: Amgen is being sued over an alleged unlawful decision to end discounted drug sales to Sagebrush Health Services under the federal 340B Drug Pricing Program. The lawsuit claims the move restricts access to lower cost medications for patients served by Sagebrush, which focuses on underserved communities. The case centers on Amgen's compliance with 340B rules that aim to reduce drug costs for vulnerable patient groups. For investors watching NasdaqGS:AMGN, this legal dispute arrives with the...

headline: Amgen beats Q4 expectations with 9% revenue growth, issues strong 2026 guidance
summary: Investing.com -- Amgen (NASDAQ:AMGN) reported fourth-quarter earnings that exceeded analyst expectations, with revenue climbing 9% to $9.9 billion compared to the consensus estimate of $9.46 billion. Shares were up 1.3% in after hours trading Tuesday following the announcement.

content.title: Amgen beats Q4 expectations with 9% revenue growth, issues strong 2026 guidance

headline: Amgen (NASDAQ:AMGN) Reports Upbeat Q4 CY2025
summary: Biotech company Amgen (NASDAQ:AMGN) reported Q4 CY2025 results beating Wall Street’s revenue expectations, with sales up 8.6% year on year to $9.87 billion. The company’s full-year revenue guidance of $37.7 billion at the midpoint came in 1.8% above analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $5.29 per share was 11.9% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

content.title: Amgen (NASDAQ:AMGN) Reports Upbeat Q4 CY2025
content.summary: Biotech company Amgen (NASDAQ:AMGN) reported Q4 CY2025 results beating Wall Street’s revenue expectations, with sales up 8.6% year on year to $9.87 billion. The company’s full-year revenue guidance of $37.7 billion at the midpoint came in 1.8% above analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $5.29 per share was 11.9% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Amgen: Q4 Earnings Snapshot
summary: AMGN) on Tuesday reported fourth-quarter profit of $1.33 billion. On a per-share basis, the Thousand Oaks, California-based company said it had profit of $2.45. Earnings, adjusted for non-recurring costs, were $5.29 per share.

content.title: Amgen: Q4 Earnings Snapshot
content.summary: AMGN) on Tuesday reported fourth-quarter profit of $1.33 billion. On a per-share basis, the Thousand Oaks, California-based company said it had profit of $2.45. Earnings, adjusted for non-recurring costs, were $5.29 per share.

headline: Amgen quarterly results beat Street estimates on higher sales, lower tax rate
summary: Feb 3 () - Amgen on Tuesday reported fourth-quarter financial results that came in ahead of Wall Street expectations, driven by a 7% ​increase in drug sales and a lower tax rate. The California-based biotech company's ‌overall quarterly revenue rose 9% from a year earlier to $9.

headline: Amgen (AMGN) Q4 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
summary: Amgen Inc. delivered strong operational performance across the board in 2025, and you can see that in the breadth of our business.  Three of these, Repatha, Evenity, and TestSpire, all grew by more than 30% year over year in 2025.

headline: Amgen Eyes Buy Zone After Fourth-Quarter Beat As Obesity Studies Mount
summary: Amgen stock popped late Tuesday — and could retake its buy zone — after the biotech behemoth easily topped fourth-quarter expectations on the back of big sales beats from cholesterol drug Repatha and osteoporosis treatment Prolia.  The company also reaffirmed its bullish plans for obesity treatment MariTide.  In after-hours trades on today's stock market, Amgen stock rose more than 1% to 343.

content.title: Amgen Eyes Buy Zone After Fourth-Quarter Beat As Obesity Studies Mount
content.summary: Amgen stock popped late Tuesday — and could retake its buy zone — after the biotech behemoth easily topped fourth-quarter expectations on the back of big sales beats from cholesterol drug Repatha and osteoporosis treatment Prolia.  The company also reaffirmed its bullish plans for obesity treatment MariTide.  In after-hours trades on today's stock market, Amgen stock rose more than 1% to 343.
